}} 'Catalonia' (, ; or ; ; ) is an autonomous community of Spain, with the
 official status of a nationality. [http://www.gencat.cat/generalitat/eng/e-
 statut/titol_preliminar.htm First article of the Statute of Autonomy of
 Catalonia. "Catalonia, as a nationality, exercises its self-government
 constituted as an autonomous community..."] Catalonia comprises four
 provinces: Barcelona, Girona, Lleida, and Tarragona. Its capital and largest
 city is Barcelona, the second largest city in Spain after Madrid, and the
 center of one of the largest metropolitan areas in Europe. Catalonia covers an
 area of 32,114 kmÂ² and has an official population of 7,535,251. [http-
 ://www.idescat.net/territ/BasicTerr?TC=5&V0=3&V1=0&V3=863&V4=435&PARENT=1&ALLI-
 NFO=TRUE&CTX=B Idescat.net]. 

It comprises the larger part of the territory of the former Principality of
Catalonia, with the remainder of the historic Catalan region now part of
southern France. Catalonia borders France and Andorra to the north and the
Mediterranean Sea to the east (580 km coastline). The neighbouring Spanish
regions of Aragon and the Valencian Community lie to the west and south
respectively. The official languages are Catalan, Spanish, and Aranese
(Occitan); Catalan Sign Language is also officially recognised. Statute of Autonomy of Catalonia (2006), Articles 6, 50.
[http://www.parlament-cat.net/porteso/estatut/estatut_angles_100506.pdf parlament-
cat.net]. The Catalan government intends to hold a referendum on
independence from Spain in 2014. http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2012/dec/13/catalonia-independence-
2014
categories: NUTS 2 statistical regions of the European Union
